title: Software Engineer, Developer Infrastructure
content:
Software Engineer, Developer Infrastructure
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
 
About the Team
The Code Team is responsible for how Stripe engineers review, maintain, store, and search for source code. We’re responsible for core infrastructure that drives our business, platforms and data that allow other teams to securely access source and gain insights, and end-to-end experiences for users who are finding and writing code. 
We have an ambitious mission to improve Stripe’s engineering productivity by a step function, by moving data and intelligence about code closer to our (internal) users. We have a runway of projects that will not only directly improve our end users, but will enable our partner teams to deliver massive developer improvements as well. 
 
What you’ll do
You’ll be responsible for planning, building and validating high impact projects to improve the foundations of Stripe’s Developer Productivity story.  As a team with an large portfolio of internal tools and services, you’ll be working across the stack to address core infrastructure challenges and dive deep into user pain to figure out the best experience we can build for our peers. You’ll be expected to work with our internal users, the rest of the team, partner teams and vendors to drive continuous improvement of our engineering experience.
 
Responsibilities
Design and build infrastructure, tools and interfaces for interacting with source control and reviews at Stripe and enabling other Stripes to do their best work.

Work directly with users to design and iterate on tooling to unblock and improve the speed of feature development.
Work with Security and Compliance partners to ensure our code review processes maintain a high bar for auditability and security.
Collaborate with other Developer Productivity engineers to build cross-cutting infrastructure to help our CI and source control infrastructure scale. 
Design, build and maintain local tools and distributed infrastructure to scale to Stripe’s needs.

Who you are
A strong, deeply technical Software Engineer with a strong user-empathy mindset for engineers. You should have experience building great products - for either internal or external users - designed to help engineers get their work done quickly. 
Minimum requirements

Minimum 3+ years of engineering experience or equivalent combined work experience reflecting domain expertise 
Demonstrated ability in building tools for engineers or equivalent technical roles
Strong demonstrated ability to use a variety of data sources (metrics, telemetry, user interviews) to identify opportunities to improve the productivity of software engineers - either as external or internal users.
Demonstrated ability to balance execution and velocity with security,reliability, and efficiency. Experience working with cross functional teams (compliance, security) to evaluate feature work against vital risk primitives.
Experience, mentoring, and investing in the development of engineers andpeers

Preferred qualifications 

5+ years of engineering experience or equivalent combined work experience reflecting domain expertise, specifically in Source Control systems, automation or tooling
Deep familiarity with git, source control systems, source control APIs, mechanics around monorepos and various ‘glue’ that makes an engineering system tick
Experience working with source control or other foundational systems in the context of a high-security environment with extensive security controls
Demonstrated ability to jump up and down the stack, from frontend UI problems to fidgety infrastructure challenges
Experience with user research and interviews
Ability to give input to team norms and rhythm of business to help teammates move quickly

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
